seo.title: Boat tours in Positano
seo.description: Private and group boat tours: what to expect, pricing ranges, and booking tips in season.

intro: Boat tours let you trace the Amalfi Coast cliffs without fighting road traffic; book ahead in peak months and keep a weather backup.

sections.title: Group tours & shared boats
body: 3-hour shared cruises leave Positano mid-morning and include swim stops; expect €85–€120 per person in July–August.
Bring swim shoes and a light layer—the breeze is cooler offshore than on the terraces.

sections.title: Private charters
body: Skippers quote €550–€850 for half-day gozzo charters (up to 6 people) plus fuel; confirm inclusions like prosecco or towels.
Negotiate start times around sunrise or late afternoon if you want gentler light and fewer wakes from ferries.

sections.title: Weather & backup plans
body: Operators cancel when winds exceed Force 4; keep a bus or beach plan ready so the day stays relaxed.
Seas can be choppy even in summer—pack motion-sickness bands if you are prone.

tips: Arrive 20 minutes before departure to settle the balance and slip on provided deck shoes.
Carry a dry bag for phones and a 1 L (34 oz) water bottle; shade is limited onboard.

a: Yes in May–September—boats often sell out a few days ahead, especially sunset slots.
Group tours usually provide one per person; private skippers vary, so pack a quick-dry towel to be safe.
